item.title: Amazing coders help (soul split)
item.dc:creator: @Zoft Zoft
item.description:
@Zoft wrote:

Well you could just rip a projectile void from a 317 and edit it to work on a 525, then for the GFX if you can’t find a GFX list you will have to find it manually, because I don’t think there is one laying around.

Read full topic

item.title: Amazing coders help (soul split)
item.dc:creator: @cocky cocky
item.description:
@cocky wrote:

Hey guys, its me cocky… (claws is killerscape) and i need help with soulsplit… it has the proper effects and everything, but not the projectile… i currently have jst a c00l gfx, but i want the actualy projectile. This is my 525 server, and heres my soul split (in player.java):

if (opp.usingPrayer(24)) { //soulsplit effect int toHitpoints = (int)Math.floor(damage / 5); int toPrayer = (int)Math.floor(damage / 5); int casterX = opp.absX; int casterY = opp.absY; int offsetX = (opp.playerId) * playerId; int offsetY = (opp.playerId) * playerId; if (opp.skillLvl[3] + toHitpoints > opp.getLevelForXP(3)) toHitpoints = opp.getLevelForXP(3) - opp.skillLvl[3]; opp.getActionSender().slopedProjectile(opp, casterY, casterX, offsetY, offsetX, 50, 0, 384, 46, 31, opp.playerId, 1); getActionSender().slopedProjectile(opp, casterY, casterX, offsetY, offsetX, 50, 0, 384, 46, 31, playerId, 1); requestGFX(90, 100); if (skillLvl[3] - damage <= 0) { if ((int)Math.floor(damage / 4) + opp.skillLvl[3] <= opp.getLevelForXP(3)) toHitpoints = (int)Math.floor(damage / 4); else toHitpoints = opp.getLevelForXP(3) - opp.skillLvl[3]; } opp.getActionSender().slopedProjectile(opp, casterY, casterX, offsetY, offsetX, 50, 0, 384, 46, 31, opp.playerId, 1); getActionSender().slopedProjectile(opp, casterY, casterX, offsetY, offsetX, 50, 0, 384, 46, 31, playerId, 1); requestGFX(90, 100); opp.skillLvl[3] += toHitpoints; opp.getActionSender().setSkillLvl(this, 3); if (skillLvl[5] - toPrayer < 0) toPrayer = getLevelForXP(5) - skillLvl[5]; skillLvl[5] -= toPrayer; getActionSender().setSkillLvl(this, 5); opp.getActionSender().slopedProjectile(opp, casterY, casterX, offsetY, offsetX, 50, 0, 384, 46, 31, opp.playerId, 1); getActionSender().slopedProjectile(opp, casterY, casterX, offsetY, offsetX, 50, 0, 384, 46, 31, playerId, 1); }
So thats it… just tell me how to add projectile, and the proper gfx for it, and i will be super grateful!

Read full topic
